metadata.name: Universal Rayhatcher #152
metadata.description:
# What is this?

This is 6942 characters of highly experimental code.

This is a version of my rayhatcher framework (see https://www.fxhash.xyz/article/rayhatching-evolution) that can do literally everything. Or, at least anything you can do within 512 characters of Javascript code. Which is slightly more than a mortal brain can comprehend.

This is my answer to the question: What is the least restrictive set of parameters for fx(params)?

# Should I be minting this?

Depends if you know and like building SDF formulas. Otherwise probably not. Like I said, this is highly experimental code. But it's definitely worth checking the collection and/or secondary for cool stuff that is already minted.

# How does it work?

The minter designs an SDF (Signed Distance Function) which is rendered using my rayhatcher algorithm. They then use the SDF formula in the SDF Code parameter. It's not very complicated, just efficient.

You can press "h" to load the documentation and read about how everything works. Or you can press "d" to read the dev docs. 

# Anything else?

Don't forget that the "Title Seed" param also becomes the "Title" feature of the mint, so make it count.

The params, including the SDF code actually get saved on-chain. Even better, all params and the entire code required to reproduce the image are included in the SVG when saved. See https://twitter.com/piterpasma/status/1649071912742420482 .

(c) 2023 by Piter Pasma // https://piterpasma.nl

metadata.name: Reunion #149
metadata.description:
Reunion

---------------

Controls:
S: Export image at current scale
1-6: Change image scale (for higher quality downloads; default: 1)
F: Fit to screen (note that this can change the piece considerably; default: off)
G: Toggle grain (default: on)
O: Toggle border (default: off)
D: Toggle distortion (default: on)
A: Toggle chromatic abberation (default: on)
C: Toggle circles (default: on)
B: Toggle reversed B-side (default: off)

---------------

Outputs are generated using the minter's address as a seed. Each wallet is given a set of 25 seeds to look through. These are the only outputs that wallet can mint. Take your time and pick your favorite

---------------

Tyler Boswell (@teaboswell) 2023
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0, See bundle.js.LICENSE.txt for third party license information

metadata.name: Dragons #491
metadata.description:
A grid of many lines forming a dragon crafted on paper.
They all have their own personality... Be sure to name and take care of them.

tw: williamapan

metadata.name: [fxhashturnsone] 2022 A Generative Odyssey #3
metadata.description:
🪐🌌✨

2022 A Generative Odyssey (Story of a traveler)

A simple space landscape generator 🏞
Allows some exploration for curious ones 📡
Don't forget to press "4" to take a panoramic picture 📸🤳

🕳🧭🛰



-----
* Technics *

- JavaScript / ThreeJS / WebGL
- Pure code / no external assets
- Interactive / orbitable
- 8 scenes with unlimited possible variations
- 5 capture / screenshot modes 8K+

-----
* Controls *

Left click / touch + drag : orbit around center of interest
Wheel/pinch : zoom in/out
Keyboard "R" : enable automatic rotation of view

Keyboard "1" : PNG capture the current view at same resolution / ratio 
Keyboard "2" : PNG capture view as square 4320x4320
Keyboard "3" : PNG capture at best resolution 8K (7680x4320)
Keyboard "4" : PNG capture as panoramic view (8192x2304)
Keyboard "5" : PNG capture as super-panoramic (10650x3000)

-----
* URL modifier *

"&r=1"
enables auto rotation of view (equivalent to "R" key press)

-----
* Mint details *

- Mint preview / capture is PNG 1920x1920

-----
@HAL09999 – May/November 2022

metadata.name: purzOS - Lowpoly Lava Lamp #26
metadata.description:
The first purzOS release is a meditative retrowave low poly lava lamp designed with an 80s Max Headroom aesthetic.

I used various conway-hart polyhedral notation strings to drive the geometry of the Polyhedrons that make up the blobs, each piece selects from an array of different possibilities. That's a very nerdy way of saying the blobs have all kinds of fun geometric shapes.

Controls
--------

drag - spin blobs
right click - reset blobs
i - hold for info cardfx
r - restart

Variables
---------

Palette
Gradient Direction
Blob Type
Blob Amount
Blob Positions
Blob Scale Speed
Blob Wiggle Speed
Blob Rotation Speed
Blob Shine
Blob Iridescence 
Stripe Width
Stripe Speed
Stripe Direction


Resources
---------

Cables.gl - https://cables.gl
Conway-Hart Implementation - https://github.com/mikolalysenko/conway-hart

metadata.name: Trust #90
metadata.description:
Trust is an abstraction of the creative process, finding the line just before form becomes texture. Your experience with the painting requires trust; trust that something will appear from the chaos of the empty space, trust that the composition you imagine halfway through will evolve along with your ideas, and trust that the etchings lend a helping hand to the message of the piece. You may find yourself pulled left and right when decisions are made, and your interpretation at 25%, 50%, and 90% will all differ. This is what makes creating so fulfilling to me, a work of art can change course wildly from start to finish, ever molding itself until it enters the kiln.

Press ‘1’, ‘2’, or  ‘3’ to increase resolution (default is 1, higher than default may not work on certain browsers. Successfully testing in Chrome, Brave, and Opera GX with hardware acceleration enabled)

Click or tap to zoom to full res (exact zoom depends on your display)
Press ’s’ to save a .png
Press ’t’ to toggle brush texture

Created with p5.js and chroma.js

metadata.name: Clerestory #117
metadata.description:
Windows welcome daylight, admit fresh air, and offer a view into the outside world. They rarely shatter, always confess the passage of time, and sometimes allow others a chance to look in.

What would the space you're in feel like if it had no windows?

'Clerestory' is an abstract exploration of stained glass windows, drafting shattered sketches for ten potential locations from various perspectives and moments in time. 

Made with WebGL, p5.js, and <3 | CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Requiem: Cloud #51
metadata.description:
<Requiem: Cloud> is a gen art project created by Jinyao Lin using p5js.

There are 103 color sets, 3 frame, 4 fragment and 2 dyeing types.

metadata.name: Gardens of delusion #1
metadata.description:
We live in a perpetual state of assertive belief, and the outside world never faults us, because we escape contradiction through a process of delusion. How reassuring it is to wander in the alleys of subjectivity and take a seat to look at these gardens we create.

Click to play the audio track.
You can zoom in/out, drag and pan.
Press « A » to toggle the autoplay mode that will change the scene every 600 frames.
Press the space bar to download a screenshot of the current frame :
- width : 4096px
- height : based on ratio
- file format : PNG

———————

Gardens of delusion by Ferdinand Dervieux, 2022
Made with threejs
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Avoidance #270
metadata.description: Created with Javascript and p5js. Each bar steers clear of the other bars and balls. This is an experiment in which I admittedly invested a little too much time. The numerous variables, factors, and variants ensure that each mint has a distinct outcome.

metadata.name: Orbit of Influence #123
metadata.description:
Orbit of Influence is part of the fxhash live minting experience at Proof of People, ZeroSpace NYC, 2023 and is a unique generative program created using processing's p5js and SVG. Developed from scratch, it employs a system of rule-based environments that have been a source of satisfaction for me since 1995.

The program generates three invisible planets, each at a different scale - small, medium, and large. Fifty objects then randomly select a planet, a speed to orbit around it, and one of three brush sizes - small, medium, or large. These objects move around their respective planets, painting color and texture across the planetary orbit in three-dimensional space.

To reveal the blueprint of the system, press the "s" key on your keyboard. The hidden algorithm that governs the brushes' movement is then displayed, revealing a mesmerizing display of synchronized choreography as the brushes interconnect with each other.

Press the following keys to interact :

- '1': swap the background color to "ocean"
- '2': swap the background color to "mist"
- '3': swap the background color to "lilac"
- '4': swap the background color to "amethyst"
- '5': swap the background color to "crimson"
- '6': swap the background color to "emerald"

- 'l': toggle animation loop on/off
- 's': system reveal, show the blueprint of the algorithm

Joshua Davis / PrayStation 'Orbit of Influence' / (2023) real-time generative program, 1240 x 1653 px, Date Minted: April 2023

Twitter: @joshuadavis
Instagram: @praystation
Website: https://joshuadavis.com

Bio :

Since 1995, Joshua Davis is an artist, technologist, author and designer in algorithmic image making & animation. Using programming, he writes his own code to produce interactions with users and to generate visual compositions according to rule-based, randomized processes.

Joshua has exhibited his works and/or lectured at the Ars Electronica (Austria), Centre Georges Pompidou (France), Contemporary Arts Center (Cincinnati), J. Paul Getty Museum (Los Angeles),  the Tate Modern (London), the Design Museum (London), the Institute of Contemporary Arts (London), PS.1 MoMA (New York), the Whitney (New York), the Smithsonian’s Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum (New York), the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao (Spain), among others.

Since 2000, Joshua has lectured globally about his work, inspirations and motivations at museums, galleries, institutions, art festivals, etc., and has spoken at the TED (2005) and 99U (2013) conferences about his career in algorithmic image making and open source.

metadata.name: Grin #22
metadata.description:
This piece tried to capture the subtle sensation of perceiving a grin expression. Interpreting the sense of emotions that are perceived.

Press ’s’ on the live mode to save the screen capture.

Made using Hydra (https://hydra.ojack.xyz/)

Rangga Purnama Aji, 2022
https://linktr.ee/ranggapuraji

metadata.name: Totemic #26
metadata.description:
This piece was an interpretation of the existence of the spiritual object. The pulsating flow was an interpretation of the spiritual stimuli within the soul energy.

Press ’s’ on the live mode to save the screen capture.

Made using Hydra (https://hydra.ojack.xyz/)

Rangga Purnama Aji, 2022
https://linktr.ee/ranggapuraji

metadata.name: Solitude Meditation #40
metadata.description:
"A room, a space, a solitude corner within the inner thought. Existed as a place to meditate and replenish the soul to be more at ease."

This piece means to mimic a sense of a dark room that contains radiated warm lights with subtle movement. It will follow the current resolution of the window where it is placed.

/////INTERACTIVITY/////
Do all the instructions below after opening the live mode.

1. To capture the screen, press the "c" button on your computer keyboard.

2. To save a 3-second .GIF from your iteration, press the "s" button on your computer keyboard. Please be patient while waiting for the piece to save and render its frames.

3. To adjust the piece resolution, you need to set your browser first and then reload the browser every time you want to capture the screen or save the rendered .GIF file.
///////////////////////

Created using Hydra and p5.js

Rangga Purnama Aji, 2022
https://linktr.ee/ranggapuraji

metadata.name: Botanical Ghosts #191
metadata.description:
This is a work about growth, impermanence and decay. Ghostly plants and flowers grow around an invisible point, but they immediately begin to fade into the dark background and are soon replaced and covered by others. This process of accumulation and disappearance builds an ever-changing floral garland, or perhaps a funeral wreath.

The monochrome vegetation is part of a fictional flora, born out of random algorithmic combinations, and does not intend to reproduce any real species. It belongs to an “artificial nature” which, like so many worlds that the computers generate for us in movies, games, and virtual reality environments, is a convincing simulation of life, but it is not actually living. AI bots, virtual assistants and non-player characters are also representatives of the uncanny realm of the not-really-alive-but-looking-like-it, which are becoming an increasingly relevant presence in our everyday lives.

These plants and flowers speak about life as a process of incessant renovation, but also about death as the background that’s always there and makes life possible. This spectral vegetation seems to thrive precisely at the verge between both worlds.
_______________


This work is animated and will adapt to any screen size. It generates a never-ending ring of algorithmic foliage, which never repeats itself, and is different for each token. The image preview is triggered after the first five plants or flowers.
Made with p5.js

Controls:
[SPACE] to play/pause
[f] to toggle fullscreen
[s] to download capture

metadata.name: Curtain #134
metadata.description:
The curtain of particles smears across the screen.

In live mode, tap the 's' key at any time to save a large version of it.

Enjoy!

metadata.name: Annum #4006
metadata.description:
This project is being released in celebration of the 1 year aniversary of Achromat, my first release on fxhash. In addition to being inspired by Achromat, aspects of other previous projects have been incorporated. My deepest gratitude to all who have collected my work over the past year.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

50% of primary sales go to Savepakistan.
